pageContext.description:
Christ has fallen while carrying the cross on his shoulder. He looks at both the viewer and at Simon of Cyrene who has hurried to assist him. Further behind the Virgin and St John are represented as well as two soldiers armed with clubs. 

[Görres, cda 2015]

Dimensions including frame: 35.9 x 28.8 x 5.5 cm
[Anhaltische Gemälde-Galerie, revised 2011]

- top left:
paper label, feather in brown 'Nr. (?) [illegible] 27'
- top right:

- centre:
paper label 'Jest: 1277 [pencil] / No 284 / Tob. Stimer [with smeared ink marks]'
- below in the centre:
paper label with an inscription, handwritten in blue ink 'Cranach, Lukas-Schule / 320 Christi Fall unter dem Kreuz / Jst 1277'
- below:
in cyrillic script no., brush in black '3K 613' (framed with a painted line in black)
- top in the centre:
no. , white chalk '1 1?5' (the central number is partially covered by the label beneath)
- bottom left:
white chalk 'PK (?)'

blue pen '79'

pencil '1277' (crossed out in blue pen)
- below:
pencil '115' (crossed out in blue pen)

metadata.title: Christ falls on the way to Calvary

pageContext.provenance:
- old ducal Inv. No. 1277, Joachim-Ernst-Stiftung
[Anhaltische Gemälde-Galerie, revised 2011]

- origin unknown
- since 1863 recorded in the Gotisches Haus in Wörlitz (in Duke Franz's bed chamber)

[Klingen, Cat. Dessau 1996, 37]
pageContext.relatedWorks:
- Part of a Passion series. Further panels can be found in the Gemäldegalerie Berlin: Inv. No. 564 B, [Cat. Berlin 1975, No. 69]; on the art market (see The Burlington Magazine, CXIII, 1971, 1, XXV als Hans Burgkmaier); and [Schade 1974, 430, Figs. c, d, 431, Figs. c, d, Plate 91]

[Klingen, Cat. Dessau 1996, 37]

tests.text:
DESCRIPTION

Tools/Materials:
- fluid black pigmented medium; executed with a pointed brush (?) and quill (?)

Type/Ductus: 
- detailed and freehand underdrawing
- thin to broad, sketchy lines of varying length

Function:
- only roughly binding for the final painted version; lines define form and delineate contours, roughly indicating folds in the drapery; there is little representation of volume

Deviations: 
- numerous minor alterations in the painted version to clearly define form
 
INTERPRETATION

Attribution:
- Workshop Cranach the Elder

[Smith, Sandner, Heydenreich, cda 2012]

titles.title: Christ falls on the way to Calvary
